description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts that relate to the taxonomy language found in either the HITRUST Threat Catalogue or the ENISA Threat Taxonomy.
name: OSRS Operational Framewrok - Nefarious Threat
source: HITRUST Threat Catalogue and the ENISA Threat Taxonomy

values.description: Using authorized access to perform illegitimate actions.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN1 Abuse of Authorizations

values.description: The illegitimate takeover of groups of IP addresses.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN2 Address Space Hijacking

values.description: Unauthorized modifications to code or configuration data, attacking its integrity.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN3 Alteration of Software

values.description: Access of web sites through chains of HTTP proxies (obfuscation), bypassing the security mechanism(s).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN4 Anonymous Proxies

values.description: Overtaking, by the attacker, the ownership of a whole autonomous system and its prefixes despite origin validation.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN5 Autonomous System Hijacking

values.description: Unauthorized access via systematically checking all possible keys or passwords until the correct one is found.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN6 Brute Force

values.description: Exploiting a bugs, design flaws or configuration oversights in an operating system or software application to gain elevated access to resources.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN7 Code Injections

values.description: Execution of arbitrary commands on the host operating system via a vulnerable application. This attack differs from Code Injection, in that code injection allows the attacker to add his own code that is then executed by the application. In Command Injection, the attacker extends the default functionality of the application, which execute system commands, without the necessity of injecting code. Also know as Remote Command Execution.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN8 Command Injection

values.description: An account id (or) username has been used (or) accessed by a non authorized means.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN9 Compromised Credentials

values.description: Service unavailability due to a massive number of requests for services from a single point.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN10 Denial of Service

values.description: Service unavailability due to a massive number of requests for access to network services from multiple malicious clients.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN11 Distributed Denial of Service

values.description: Domain name server cache poising or spoofing to divert traffic to malicious servers.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN12 DNS Spoofing

values.description: A compromised website that has a user unintentionally download malware.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN13 Drive By Download

values.description: Roles or permissions with more than the normal level of access that if compromised could allow a person to exploit the systems for personal gain or illicit purpose.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN14 Elevated Privileges

values.description: Spying on information through capturing emanations from operational equipment.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN15 Emission Attacks

values.description: A type of injection in which malicious scripts are injected into otherwise benign and trusted websites.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN16 HTML Script Injection

values.description: The deliberate sharing of information with unauthorized entities such as emailing sensitive information or file transfers.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN17 Information Sharing

values.description: IP spoofing is a method of attack under which incorrect IP addresses are used to disguise the attackersâ€™ identity to the system being attacked.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN18 IP Spoofing

values.description: To exploit web based applications that construct LDAP statements based on user input.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN19 LDAP Injection

values.description: An attacker can change the Media Access Control (MAC) address of his device and send Ethernet frames in the network segment with a different ID, which can result in the possible circumvention of security mechanisms which are based solely on the use of a MAC address.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN20 MAC Spoofing

values.description: Injection of malicious code to extend the functionality of an application or information system without having to execute commands.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN21 Malicious Code Execution

values.description: A type of eavesdropping attack that occurs when a malicious actor inserts himself as a relay (or) proxy into a communication session between people or systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN22 Man in the Middle

values.description: Modification of an encryption module in order to read secret keys, change keys, or change security parameters.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN23 Manipulation of an Encryption Module

values.description: The modification of data with the intent to cause loss of integrity.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN24 Manipulation of Data

values.description: Lying or decieving to pretend to be someone one is not.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN25 Masquerade OR Pretexting

values.description: Threat in which a valid data transmission is maliciously or fraudulently repeated or delayed.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN26 Message Replay

values.description: The malicious use of network scanning tools to discover open and possibly unused ports, protocols, and services as well as vulnerabilities.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN27 Misuse of Audit Tools

values.description: Unauthorized access to network.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN28 Network Intrusion

values.description: Identifying information about a network to find security weaknesses.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN29 Network Sniffing

values.description: An email fraud method in which the perpetrator sends out legitimate-looking email in an attempt to gather personal and financial information from recipients. Typically, the messages appear to come from well-known and trustworthy websites.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN30 Phishing

values.description: The attacker promises to provide a benefit or service in the return of vital access or details.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN31 Quid Pro Quo

values.description: Infection of a computer system or device by malware that restricts access to the system and information while demanding that the user pays a ransom to remove the restriction.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN32 Ransomware

values.description: Remote administration capabilities allowing an attacker to control the victim's computer.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN33 Remote Access Trojan (RAT)

values.description: Intentional data manipulation to repudiate action.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN34 Repudiation of Actions

values.description: The process by which a man-made object is deconstructed to reveal its design, architecture, or to extract knowledge from the object.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN35 Reverse Engineering (RE)

values.description: Unauthorized access via unmanaged access points to an organizations managed network.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN36 Rogue Access Points

values.description: Use of rogue certificates that are valid certificates by a legitimate certificate authority which are untrustworthy.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN37 Rogue Certificates

values.description: Malicious software that misleads users about their computers security in order to manipulate them.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN38 Rogue Security Software

values.description: A set of software tools that enable an unauthorized user to gain control of a computer system without being detected.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN39 Rootkits

values.description: Routing network packets to IP addresses not intended by sender via unauthorized manipulation of routing table.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN40 Routing Table Manipulation

values.description: Deliberate manipulation of search engine indexes to direct a user to malicious content on falsified sites.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN41 Search Engine Poisoning

values.description: Allows the exploitation of a web application by injecting scripts in HTML pages or executing arbitrary codes remotely.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN42 Server-Side Includes (SSI) Injection

values.description: Receiving unsolicited, undesired, or illegal email messages.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN43 SPAM

values.description: Phishing while tailoring the email to a specific audience.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN44 Spear Phishing

values.description: Software that aims to gather information about a person or organization without their knowledge.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN45 Spyware

values.description: Takes advantage of the syntax of SQL to inject commands that can read or modify a database, or compromise the meaning of the original query.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN46 SQL injection

values.description: Any malicious computer program which misleads users of its true intent.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN47 Trojan

values.description: Not abiding by the rules defined as acceptable by the governing or owning entity.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN48 Unacceptable Use

values.description: Attaining logical access without permission or approval.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN49 Unauthorized Access

values.description: Use of an unauthorized (insecure) encryption module can lead to a false sense of protection the encryption was meant to protect.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN50 Unauthorized Encryption

values.description: The intentional installation of unmanaged or unauthorized software.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN51 Unauthorized Software Installation

values.description: A computer program that can copy itself and infect a computer without permission or knowledge of the user. A virus might corrupt or delete data on a computer, use e-mail programs to spread itself to other computers, or even erase everything on a hard disk.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN52 Virus

values.description: A form of fraud using voice over internet protocol in which individuals are tricked into revealing unauthorized access to sensitive information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN53 Vishing

values.description: The act of locating and possibly exploiting wireless networks; example access point mapping.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN54 War Driving

values.description: Malware residing on the websites which a group often uses.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN55 Watering Holes

values.description: Web spoofing occurs when an attacker forges an existing website (i.e., an attacker designs a fake website in such a way that it looks like the website of a known organization) The attacker attempts to draw users to the website with the objective of launching further attacks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN56 Web Spoofing

values.description: A form of spear phishing that targets senior management, executives, or prominent individuals in order to gain access to sensitive information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN57 Whaling

values.description: The surreptitious electronic monitoring of Internet-based communications.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN58 Wire Tapping

values.description: Self propagating standalone malicious software.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST LIN59 Worms

values.description: An employee that applies their authority incorrectly, or oversteps their level of authority.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN1 Abuse of Authority

values.description: Searching through discarded assets with the intent of personal gain and (or) damage.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN2 Dumpster Diving

values.description: The deliberate sharing of non-public information with unauthorized entities, such as physically giving sensitive documents.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN3 Information Sharing

values.description: Unauthorized changes of hardware devices such as removing memory or hard drive.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN4 Manipulation of Hardware

values.description: Lying or decieving to pretend to be someone one is not.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN5 Masquerade or Pretexting

values.description: The attacker promises to provide a benefit or service in the return of vital access or details.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN6 Quid Pro Quo

values.description: The process by which a man-made object is deconstructed to reveal its design, architecture, or to extract knowledge from the object.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN7 Reverse Engineering (RE)

values.description: Manipulation due to unauthorized hardware.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN8 Rogue Hardware

values.description: Unauthorized access by someone else's means of access at their time of entry.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN9 Tailgating

values.description: Not abiding by the rules defined as acceptable by the governing or owning entity.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN10 Unacceptable Use

values.description: Attaining physical access without premission or approval.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: HITRUST PIN11 Unauthorized Access

values.description: Threat of disclosure transmitted information using interception and analysis of compromising emission.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Intercepting Compromising Emissions

values.description: Threat of interception of information improperly secured in transmission or through improper actions of the staff. This may also included corporate or nation state espionage as well as information lost via unsecured Wi-Fi (or, rogue access points).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Interception of Information

values.description: Threat of failure of IT hardware or transmission connection due to electromagnetic induction or electromagnetic radiation emitted from an another source.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Interfering Radiation

values.description: Threat in which valid data transmission is maliciously or fraudulently repeated or delayed.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Replay of Messages

values.description: Threat of identifying information about network to find security weaknesses.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Network Reconnaissance, Network Traffic Manipulation and Information gathering

values.description: Threats that relay on alters of communication between two parties.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Man in the Middle or Session Hijacking

values.description: Threat of identity theft action. This may also be the result of malicious software like credential stealing trojans.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Identity Theft, Identity Fraud, or Account Abuse

values.description: Threat of receive of unsolicited E-mail that affect for information security and efficienty of work. This also includes SPAM or unsolcited infected malicious e-mails.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Receive of Unsolicited E-mail

values.description: Threat of Denial of Service type attacks at information systems or services. This includes malformed packets, flooding, XDoS, DDoS, amplification attacks etc.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Denial of Service

values.description: Threat of malicious code or software execution. This includes abuse of resources, search engine poisoning, exploitation of social media trust, worms, trojans, rootkits, web application attacks (XSS), spyware, viruses, rogue security software, and exploit kits.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Malicious Code, Software, or Activity

values.description: Social engineering is the deliberate attempt at manipulating a person or group's decision making process. Often this tactic is used to achieve privileges within a system or obtain organizational assets. This may be through direct physical contact, or may include phishing as well as spear phishing attacks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Social Engineering

values.description: Abusing information gained via unauthorized access and then exploiting this information against the target organization. Information leaks may be derived from mobile applications, network traffic, local systems, or cloud services.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Abuse of Information Leakage

values.description: Threat of use of rogue certificates. This may cause a loss of certificate integrity, man-in-the-middle attacks, session hijacking, use of signed malware, and installation of fake SSL certificates.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Generation and Use of Rogue Certificates

values.description: Threat of unauthorized manipulation of hardware and software. This may allow the use of anonamous proxies, the abuse of computing power, the abuse of vulnerabilities (0-day), unauthorized access to web sites, access to local device software, alteration of local device software, or the installation of rogue hardware.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Manipulation of Hardware and Software

values.description: Threat of intentional data manipulation to mislead information systems or an individual in order to cover other nefarious activities (loss of integrity of information). This may include repudiation of actions, address space hijacking, DNS manipulation, falsification of web records, adress space hijacking, address space manipulation, or falsification of system configuration.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Manipulation of Information

values.description: Threat of nefarious actions with use of audit tools (i.e. used to discovery security weaknesses in information systems).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Misuse of Audit Tools

values.description: Threat of nefarious action due to misuse of information or information systems.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Misuse of Information or Information Systems

values.description: Threat of activities not authorized to the user or group within an organization. This may include unuthorized use of devices, unauthorized administration of devices, unauthorized use of software, unauthorized access to devices, network intrusion, or an unauthorized change of records.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Unauthorized Activities

values.description: Threat of unauthorized installation of software. This may also include such things as drive-by downloads or browser based attacks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Unauthorized Installation of Software

values.description: Threat of data breach.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Compromising Confidential Information (Data Breaches)

values.description: Threat of disruption of work due to False rumor and (or) a fake warning.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Hoax

values.description: Threat of remote activity over controled IT Assets. This may include Remote Command Execution, Remote Code Execution (RCE), Remote Access Tools (RAT), or botnets.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Remote Activity or Execution

values.description: Threat of sophisticated targetes attack with combination of many attack techniques (i.e. Advanced Persistent Threat - APT). A targeted attack may include the use of mobile malware, spear phishing attacks, installation of sophisticated malware, or watering hole type attacks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Targeted Attacks

values.description: Threat of repeated attempts at cracking account passwords or encryption algorythms.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Brute Force

values.description: Malicious abuse of sanctioned user or group authorization to systems or information.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA Abuse of Authorizations

values.description: Threat of locating and possible exploite connection to the wireless network.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Nefarious Threat: ENISA War Driving
